body: I think we should just remove the `string` typehint from `$content` argument of `tableCell()`. the `vsprintf()` in string formatter will eventually take care of typecasting any value to string.
@ADmad is that also true for php 8 in strict mode?
The individual items of `$args` array are of mixed type and pretty sure it won't change in PHP 8. Test case would confirm that since we run builds in PHP 8 too.

Adding the cast might still be a bit more BC than removing a typehint.
Also phpstan would complain about any non string input anyway due to docblock.

My point of view is, to leave the string typehint until cakephp is PHP-8+ only. Then uniontypes of PHP-8 can be handy with a typehint deceleration of "string|int|float". 
When passing objects, void, null ... i still would aspect an exception, instead of having an silent conversion to a string. So just removing the string typehint from tableCell() is maybe not the best way to go. 
vsprintf() would typecast bool and null to an empty string without exception, if i remember it correctly.
@YveIce Do you want to make a PR with the suggested changes?

> vsprintf() would typecast bool and null to an empty string without exception

I personally have no problem with that. All falsey PHP values would be same in string/HTML.
That said I don't mind if we just cast to string when calling tableCells(). Changing typehint is not something we can do in a patch release anyway.

> a typehint deceleration of "string|int|float"

The list should include `Stringable` too :)

issue.title: Typecast numeric cell values to string in HtmlHelper::_renderCells()

repository.name: cakephp
repository.description: CakePHP: The Rapid Development Framework for PHP - Official Repository

issue.body:
This patch typecast numeric cell values to string in HtmlHelper::_renderCells() before passing it to HtmlHelper::tableCell(), while strict typehint "String" for HtmlHelper::tableCell() stays untouched.
I personally would avoid to check if method "__toString()" exists if an class/object is passed, at the time of PHP-7.x, on a later PHP-8.x only release Uniontype typehint like "stringable|string|int|float" on HtmlHelper::tableCell() will do the trick for us in a much better way. 
On type bool, everyone has his personal opinion. (And i hate flamewar). My thoughts are, that common functions like substr() return (bool) false if they fail. If we typecast them silent, users may not take notice of misbehave of there code as no exception is thrown. 

Resolves https://github.com/cakephp/cakephp/issues/14921

repository.name: cakephp
repository.description: CakePHP: The Rapid Development Framework for PHP - Official Repository
